attributes.action: Ban Horse + Greyhound racing in wake of the recent death of 'Many Clouds'
attributes.background: The UK should not allow the flogging of animals to the extreme, causing them to suffer and die needlessly for Gambling purposes. There are plenty of Human sports which can have bets placed upon them, that we should not have a reason to cause the inevitable pain and suffering to helpless animals

attributes.action: Stop the closure of A&E departments and give them the funds needed to function.
attributes.background: In Merseyside (as in other parts of the country) we are seeing the closure of essential A&E departments, which will not only defer pressure to other overstretched Hospital services in the area. It will risk lives in extending the distance to get critically ill patients the care they really need.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-merseyside-37854165

attributes.action: Reduce the fuel duty rate by 50% on all road fuels.
attributes.background: Our current fuel duty rate is 57.95 pence per litre on petrol, diesel, bio diesel and bioethanol. I believe a 50% relief of fuel duty would boost our economy hugely as well as helping the poorest get to work cheaper so they can earn more
attributes.additional_details:
As of the 1/2/17
Fuel Duty rates
The rate you pay depends on the type of fuel.

Type of fuel	Rate
Petrol, diesel, biodiesel and bioethanol	57.95 pence per litre
Liquefied petroleum gas (LPG)	31.61 pence per kg
Natural gas used as fuel in vehicles, eg biogas	24.70 pence per kg
‘Fuel oil’ burned in a furnace or used for heating	10.70 pence per litre

attributes.action: Clarify plans to protect UK Research and Universities from impacts of leaving EU
attributes.background: The prospect of leaving the EU has left the UK's Higher Education and Research sectors - among the country's most successful exporters of services - in damaging uncertainty. Can Government clarify its position on the rights of EU staff, continued research funding, and staff and student recruitment?
attributes.additional_details:
Many staff are EU citizens. Will rights to residence, healthcare, and pensions change?

The UK received €8.8bn EU research  investment 2007-13. Will we still be able to lead/join EU-funded collaborative projects  (Horizon 2020 and beyond) post-Brexit?

Fees for EU students at UK universities are currently the same as for British students. Will these increase?

Will immigration rules affect recruitment of new staff? If so, how?

Answers are needed to address damaging uncertainty in the sector.

attributes.action: Do not make the British taxpayer pay for the renovation of Buckingham Palace!
attributes.background: Following recent news that Buckingham Palace is to undergo a £369 million renovation, it should not be at the expense of the British taxpayer. In a time of perennial austerity where hospitals, schools and the "JAM" (just about managing) families are struggling, surely this renovation is arbitrary?
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/nov/18/buckingham-palace-to-undergo-370m-refurbishment
http://www.thetimes.co.uk/_TP_/edition/news/mps-urge-royals-to-chip-in-for-palace-repairs-6htfxxqpm?ni-statuscode=acsaz-307
http://www.ibtimes.co.in/no-taxpayers-money-britains-citizens-want-queen-elizabeth-pay-370-million-palace-repairs-704963

attributes.action: Stop the persecution of Zander in British canals, rivers and ponds.
attributes.background: Zander have been in England since 1878 and today hold great interest with anglers as a superb sporting fish. Their effect on tackle trade is marked as so many lure anglers spend a lot of money on all the accoutrements needed to successfully target the species.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of money is wasted trying to iradicate Zander from our waters by the Canal & Rivers Trust and yet modern anglers love to fish for them. Modern lure angling also offers children a great way of enjoying this traditional sport and Zander are a big part of the inner city street angling scene.

attributes.action: Stop the privatisation of NHS Professionals
attributes.background: NHS Professionals is the in-house recruitment and staffing agency of the NHS. The government is planning to 'seek external investment' for the organisation - i.e. sell it off to a private, profit making company.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only would this hand a private company a successful NHS agency which makes a profit and has an effective monopoly on staffing, it would also divert crucial funds away from the NHS at a time when it is struggling more than ever with successive budget cuts and increasing pressure on services.

Private companies put profits before patients. The Government must not be allowed to sell off yet another part of our NHS.

attributes.action: Introduce minimum commission rates for shopkeepers processing utility services.
attributes.background: TV Licence, Telephone, Gas and Electric payments once paid at the Post Office have been passed onto shopkeepers to process for as little as 7p maximum commission no matter how high the bill being paid. When the cash is banked, charges levied leave them in financial loss. This must end immediately.
attributes.additional_details: Shopkeepers operate upto 24hrs a day making them ideal agents for utility payment companies like PayPoint and Payzone who hold the multi-million pound contracts. Processing these payments, shopkeepers are keeping the U.K operating. Recent years have seen shopkeepers forcibly tied into long term payment processing contracts or risk losing the service which would inconvenience their customers. Then in deliberate attacks on their businesses the commission rates are cut. This exploitation must end.

attributes.action: Increase child maintenance service powers to investigate the self employed
attributes.background: Self employed people can hide earnings by dealing with cash in hand jobs and holding funds in their business accounts. By default the CMS won't investigate all associated accounts be it business or personal and often don't have the necessary powers to anyway to gather a true picture of income
attributes.additional_details: Children and full time carers are going without while irresponsible parents hide their true earnings. It should be illegal for individuals to do this and the CMS should have the powers and resource to do this from the offset for all self employed individuals. Full powers to look at recent and historic bank accounts, credit cards etc both personal and business in order to see a true account of earnings. Only then will the system be fair to struggling children and full time mothers and carers

attributes.action:
Give Foster Carers employee rights. 
Why do they have to be self employed
attributes.background:
why is it Foster Carers Are forced to be self employed in  a highly regulated profession. Local Authorities and Independent fostering agencies can get away without offering their foster Carers employment rights. 
 Foster Carers can only work for one IFA or LA they are not independent contractors

attributes.action: Increase funding for investigating tool theft for tradesmen.
attributes.background:
Yet to find a tradesman who hasn't had their tools stolen at some point in their life. It seems like there is very little investigation into tool theft and cases are quickly closed.

Took theft is extremely expensive for the victim and damages our careers and livelihoods.
attributes.additional_details: I want to see the police pay more attention to tool theft and harsher penalties for those caught handling stolen tools.

attributes.action: Ensure NIPT users can access unbiased, balanced advice post prenatal screening
attributes.background: Non Invasive Prenatal Testing may soon be available on the NHS to prenatally identify a number of conditions. Sign this petition to ensure the government offer balanced, unbiased advice on both termination AND life experiences of people with diagnosed conditions, informed by lived experience.
attributes.additional_details: Diagnosis of an unexpected condition or potential disability during a pregnancy can impact families in a number of ways. There may be feelings of shock, grief, guilt and uncertainty. At this vulnerable time it is imperative that parents are given fast, free and easy access to a professional or team of professionals who can assist them with provision of unbiased and balanced information that covers the spectrum of experience and scientific evidence concerning their particular circumstances.

attributes.action: Ban schools from serving halal meat to pupils without parents Consent
attributes.background: The Government should require schools to obtain parental consent before school pupils are served halal or pre-stunned meat.
attributes.additional_details:
Muslims object when their children are fed pork - we as a Christian culture should have right to say that our children do not eat ritually blessed food without our knowledge. 
School dinner ladies have been sacked for giving pork to muslim children but Christian children are fed halal everyday without their parents' knowledge or consent and against their beliefs.

attributes.action: Discuss the competency of Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust.
attributes.background: The Alexandra Hospital in Redditch is slowly being downgraded by the Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust.  Why?
attributes.additional_details:
The people of Redditch, Studley and Bromsgrove are affected because:
The public transport links from Redditch to Worcester are poor.
Maternity and Paedeatrics have already closed at Redditch.
The consultants are leaving the Alexandra Hospital, so more wards are closing.
The parking at Worcester Royal Hospital is inadequate.
Worcester Royal Hospital cannot cope with more patients.

The government should launch an investigation into the Trusts finances and its actions to remove services from Redditch Alexandra in favour of Worcester Royal.

attributes.action: The Government should not support any company that leaves the UK post Brexit
attributes.background: I am calling on the Government to require; that all Government bodies and all Government agencies, do not enter into a contract with, or use the services of, any company that plans to move any part of their operation out of the UK, because of its exit from the European Union.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the people of the United Kingdom to unite in threatening to boycott, the services and products of any businesses, that plan to relocate out of the UK, post Brexit.
Did you know that companies including HSBC, EasyJet & Vodafone are considering moving their offices from the UK to Europe? This would risk 1,000's of UK jobs. Help us to put the GREAT back into Great Britain by boycotting these companies & any others that threaten to leave the UK. Show your support #Letstakebackthepower

attributes.action: Repeal the ECA1972 with a commencement order attached.Notify European Council
attributes.background: Repealing the ECA1972 alone would breach the Vienna convention and the Lisbon treaty. A commencement order would allow the act to come into force at the same time as the conclusion of negotiations under article 50 and 218(3) of the Lisbon treaty. Therefore meeting our constitutional requirements.
attributes.additional_details:
The bill can reach royal assent to coincide with the governments policy to withdraw from the EU. When the bill becomes an act the government shall notify the European council of its intention to withdraw and begin negotiations on a withdrawal agreement. The Great repeal act can repeal this act later in the year.
Treaty of Lisbon
Vienna convention
Article 50 High Court ruling
Commons research papers. 13/41,13/42,7793,7702,07212,14/55,7551,07214
Lords select committee.The invoking of article 50

attributes.action: Sanction trade deals with China, for condoningBarbaric Animal Cruelty
attributes.background: Each year Billions of Animals in China meet with a grisely death. They are beaten and skinned alive and yet Britain is happy to continue trade dealing with a country with such an appaulling animal welfare record. Elephants and Rhinos are nearing extinction because of the illegal ivory trade. STOP!!!
attributes.additional_details: Each year millions of cats and dogs are bludgeoned and skinned alive.http://www.peta.org/features/nine-shocking-fur-facts/  Bad enough that they have terrible suffering whilst alive, then to meet a barbaric death is unethical. The only way China and other country's will take any action to reduce this unscrupulous cruel farming is if they are penalised. By buying goods from these country's, we condone how they do business. I do NOT and I want my Country to act in the name of compassion!

attributes.action: Stop building houses on green land while there is a mass of derelict buildings.
attributes.background: At present we are in a housing crisis which developers are going about the wrong way. We need to be building on brownfield land and refurbishing, converting or rebuilding derelict buildings for new homes. We're destroying our green land at an alarming rate which needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details: There are large amounts of abandoned buildings and factories all over the country that have been left for numerous years to fall in to decay and some even demolished and left. We need to be building on these areas before destroying our countryside with  housing developments.

attributes.action: Stop HS2
attributes.background: Stop HS2 destroying our green belt and countryside

attributes.action: A better method and understanding when dealing with miscarriage and babyloss
attributes.background:
After experiencing a miscarriage 12 weeks I found the NHS aren't educated or given the right tools to deal with this. 

We need - 

More adequate information, compassion and understanding!
attributes.additional_details:
More adequate information - currently
In my local hospital is an a4 piece of paper. Any sort of leaflet or info pack to let you what is happening and what to expect.

More compassion - it's not a taboo subject and it isn't a something to be ashamed of. 1 in 4 people suffer so why do we feel ashamed? 

Men suffer too - my partner received a day off work for compassionate leave 

We need an all round more compassionate and sensible review of how the NHS deals with a family loosing a baby

attributes.action: Give horse riders more safe places to ride &  make it law to drive past at 15mph
attributes.background: Please give us more safe places to ride and take our horses that are free from the dangers of roads and also making it law for vehicles to pass at 15mph and make it part of driving tests so riders are safer.

attributes.action: Allow baby's born after 18 weeks to be registered at birth.
attributes.background: My baby was born sleeping at 24+2 and his birth was registered. If I had him days earlier we wouldn't of had the right to have him registered. The law needs changing. I want every baby born from 18 weeks to be registered at birth and parents given a birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details: My baby was born sleeping at 24+2 and his birth was registered. He was classed as a BABY not a fetus. If I had my baby just 3 days before he wouldn't have been. He had a heartbeat that beat in me, He is a brother, and a son. We grieved, and we grieved hard! 3 days would not of made one single difference to what we went through. Every parent has the right to have there baby registered whether its 18 or 38 weeks. There baby was loved, there baby had a heart that beat, there baby was real. It's time the law changed! I want every baby born after 18 weeks to be registered and to have a birth certificate.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for 16 and 17 year olds accused of rape to be tried as adults
attributes.background:
33% of those who contact Rape Crisis Centres are under the age of 25. In the current justice system a sex offender who is aged 16 or 17 can only be tried as an adult at the discretion of a judge.
The majority of these sex offenders are sent to youth court, where the maximum sentence is 2 years.
attributes.additional_details:
With the age of sexual consent set at 16 in the UK it would be expected that individuals above this age are able to recognise when consent is not present. For this reason these individuals should be tried as adults in Crown Court.

A sentence of 2 years compared to the years of emotional torment suffered by victims of these crimes is outrageous. Stronger sentencing for these individuals would only serve to encourage more victims to report these crimes to the police and to achieve the justice that they deserve.

attributes.action: Make PIP and Atos assessors understand how eplipsy effects someone day 2 day.
attributes.background: As epilepsy is a internal mental condition they can't look on the outside of patient and see how it effects their mental state. This is a digressive condition and effects people differently, due to type of seizure they have. Only a specialist (neurologist) can tell them how it affects that person.
attributes.additional_details: The Atos assessment do not want to accept that it causes long term mental damage. Even if they did a bit of research on epilepsy they would understand how each type of seizure affects the person's brain in the long run. PIP won't go to the specialists only want the Atos assessors' view, which is discriminatory of the applicant as they are not trained in that field. Many Atos assessors are just GP nurses with no advanced medical training in this field.

attributes.action: Stop Making Tax Digital because it will be hugley burdensome on small businesses
attributes.background: HMRC is pushing ahead with Making Tax Digital: a scheme that will force all business to maintain digital accounts. Currently most small businesses use paper accounting records or spreadsheets. Small businesses lack the skills, time and funding to maintain digital accounts.
attributes.additional_details: Contrary to what HMRC have said, small businesses will not benefit from MTD. Making Tax Digital is a misnomer because businesses have been filing digital tax returns for 20 years. HMRC would gain from MTD because HMRC would receive more detailed trading information for businesses. Whilst HMRC needs to ensure it collects the correct tax, HMRC completely under estimates the cost of compliance on small businesses.

attributes.action: UK Government to urge Venezuela to release its political prisoners
attributes.background: The first time I heard that Leopoldo Lopez was arrested and convicted, I knew that it was a political move against the opposition. He never incited any violence, some protesters clashed with police because of the simple fact they are tired. Tired of corruption, crime and a failing economy.
attributes.additional_details: I do realise that by releasing some political prisoners, Venezuela won't just suddenly recuperate. However, all of those political prisoners should be released as they were just expressing their thoughts. Has Maduro's regime sunk so low that it won't even allow its opponents to express themselves?

attributes.action: Amend Shortage Occupation rules that are blocking the hiring of Specialist Chefs
attributes.background: UK's Asian cuisine industry is lacking skill ready Professional Chefs. Though Chefs are on government's Shortage Occupation list it disqualifies restaurants that allow collection or delivery of restaurant meals as NOT having specialist skill needs in spite of this involving the same skill input
attributes.additional_details:
The industry is in urgent need of experienced skill ready Chefs from outside EU on temporary basis to support business operations, and to enable training and development of home grown Chefs. However this is being prevented by inappropriate rules. This petition calls for following amendments to the Shortage Occupation rules 

1. Remove the 'take away' clause

2. Raise skill recognition to NQF level 6  

3. Amend minimum salary to £25,000 

4. Allow temporary non settlement based UK entry

attributes.action: Change the law on child sex offences .
attributes.background: I would like to create a petition to change the law in sentencing on child sex offences. The sentencing should reflect the offence and be minimum life sentencing.

attributes.action: Scrap the 30 hours childcare education funding & apply 20 hours on higher rates!
attributes.background: All early years setting are being given a rate for this 30hours that they cannot remain open with. Why not increase the hourly rates to improve quality in the sector so we can pay our staff better wages? Also provide 20 hours?
attributes.additional_details: Over the past year the sector has seen a drastic price increase of out goings to pensions, living wage and corporate tax. Also paying for staff DBS checks, training for paediatric first aid, first aid at work & food hygiene. All requirements that are set out by the statutory framework for us to run safe and secure settings. Living wage will be increasing in April how is this going to be paid for? This will come at the cost of quality, a big decline in careers and people leaving the profession!

attributes.action: Remove Corporate and Media Funding From the UK Political System.
attributes.background:
In order for the UK to have a true democracy, the interests of the electorate should be at the core of government policy. 
As long a big business and the media fund political parties, the interests of their sponsors and a desire to remain in power, prevents a government from fulfilling its duties.
attributes.additional_details:
Electoral funding should be minimised. It should be financed with public money, by a process that reflects an equal distribution to either parties or MPs. A process to be decided by parliament, if the motion is agreed. 
Media owners hold to much influence over voters. This does not benefit the electorate, but their own interests and is facilitated by their sponsorship of politics.
The same applies to corporations, in which MPs should be allowed no investments, financial (or positional) for life.

attributes.action: Ensure all doctors, nurses and paramedics know how to treat adrenal crisis
attributes.background: I have Addison's and wear a medical alert bracelet. There has been several occasions where I have become very ill because of a delay in my treatment because staff did not have sufficient knowledge of Addison's and would not take my medical alert bracelet as confirmation of my illness/treatment.
attributes.additional_details:
Addison's occurs when the body can't produce enough steroid hormone. When illness/injury occurs in someone who is healthy they produce 10x the normal amount of cortisol. Someone with Addison's can't do this so an immediate dose of cortsol injection is necessary to avoid adrenal crisis. An adrenal crisis is a life threatening, medical emergency. 
So I ask that ALL medical professionals know what Addison's is and are trained how to treat someone presenting with suspected adrenal crisis.

attributes.action: Appoint ministers for Peace and Disarmament.
attributes.background: There should be a mechanism that would make it easier to achieve peace than to achieve war, easier to facilitate peace in Northern Ireland than to start a war in Iraq. It is my proposal that all UK governments must include the senior cabinet positions of Ministers for Peace and Disarmament.
attributes.additional_details: In 1969, John Lennon sang “All we are saying is Give Peace a Chance”. In 2017, all I am saying is give peace a better chance. I believe there should be a mechanism that would make it easier to achieve peace than to achieve war, easier to facilitate peace in Northern Ireland than to start a war in Iraq. Following the appointment of Fabian Hamilton to the position of Shadow Minister for Peace and Disarmament – a post created in 2016 by Labour Leader Jeremy Corbyn – it is my proposal that from now on all UK governments must include the senior cabinet positions of Ministers for Peace and Disarmament.

attributes.action: Accept the BSA's offer of integrating lone refugee children into private schools
attributes.background:
"More than 220,000 have arrived in Europe this year, seeking safety and a better future. One in three is a child." - Unicef

In May 2016, the BSA (Boarding School's Association) offered the government more than 80 fully-funded places in private schools across Britain. They have been unfilled. Why?
attributes.additional_details: As poignant images and testimonies from refugees who have sacrificed everything to make the arduous journey become ever more common, many choose to avert their eyes in fear of the realisation that they could have done more. The British Government is among those who could do more - for a nation which has long prided itself on charity and helping those less fortunate, the paltry number is a farce. Urge them to collaborate with the BSA to restore this nation as one of the world's leading lights.

attributes.action: Set a minimum wage of £8.50 per hour for pubs and bars staff.
attributes.background: Pubs and Bar staff deal with depression, insomnia, anxiety and drugs addiction (including cocaine, alcohol and cigarettes) whilst responsible for guaranteeing the License act 2003 (http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/17/contents) with no support from an industry that makes billions every year.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.sleepdex.org/shiftwork.htm
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3823323/
https://talesofthecocktail.com/wellness/depression-alcoholism-and-our-industry-bar-vets-speak-out
https://www.bostonglobe.com/lifestyle/food-dining/2016/02/29/why-working-restaurant-industry-can-hard-your-mental-health/NaqWdSHvKJtZQCoberbLjP/story.html
https://www.thecaterer.com/articles/344050/open-minds-how-good-is-hospitalitys-mental-health

attributes.action: Introduce online voting in elections allowing more people to engage in democracy
attributes.background: Vote online using NI numbers to identify people. A unique code could be sent at registration that would then be entered along with their NI Number to secure the process. Email confirmation could be sent after voting as a security measure. This allows people to vote if out of their constituency.
attributes.additional_details:
Only 36% of 18-24 year olds voted in the last referendum, and only 66% of the electorate voted in the general election in 2015.

Younger voters are often moving around the country and unable to be at their polling station on polling day, as often they register at university only to find that they are back home at the other side of the country come polling day. 

Online voting would solve this issue and could also remind people to vote on polling day.

attributes.action: Re-open the railway line between Leicester and Burton on Trent via Coalville
attributes.background: With the recent growth in the local area and large factories opening up at Bardon and the near death of Coalville it's time to reintroduce the line.

attributes.action: Call for No Confidence in PM Theresa May
attributes.background: Theresa May was appointed as PM of the UK when David Cameron stepped down. The public did not vote for her and she does not speak for the majority of the British Public.
attributes.additional_details:
After her short time in office May has already managed to enrage most of the British Public. 
We voted her party to speak on behalf of us in parliament but she doesn't seem interested by our worries or voices. It's time someone else spoke for us.

attributes.action: Royal Parks-keep Hyde Park skate friendly. Re-think Broadwalk Treatment Works
attributes.background: Proposed cycle calming treatments to the Broadwalk in Hyde Park will make it impossible for roller skaters, scooters, wheelchair users and other wheeled recreational users to use the Broadwalk. It will force skaters to use Park Lane to access Serpentine Road with increased risk.
attributes.additional_details: Hyde park is one of the few safe places in London for children and adults to skate. The proposed works will make it impossible to use the Broadwalk. We ask the Royal Parks to first try other cycle speed calming measures, such as speed signs, more prominent cycle lane designations, sign posts and better lighting before resorting to physical intrusive treatments. In other parts of the park speeding cyclists simply go round calming treatments. Please consider all park users in this matter.

attributes.action: Bring back the DEATH penalty for PAEDOPHILES.
attributes.background: Shield Appeal is a campaign to protect the babies and children of our country . We all want the death penalty for PAEDOPHILES.
attributes.additional_details: We can't continue to allow the babies of our country to be raped and abused by these beasts . They all need to die . No more prison, no more costing the tax payers millions of pounds . Hang them .

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for politicians to lie to the public.
attributes.background: We cannot call ourselves a functioning democracy if our democratic decisions are taken based on lies and deceptions. We therefore demand that any politician who lies to or misleads the public be held legally accountable, and a new agency be set up to monitor political advertising and promotion.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that any politician who lies for personal or political gain should: 
1/ Be removed from their position
2/ Be banned from all public offices for a minimum of ten years
3/ Pay a fine based on the severity of the crime and their ability to pay
Any legislation enacted based on the lie must to be cancelled.
An independent body must be set up to monitor politicians to this effect, and also to monitor political advertising and campaign materials, similarly to the Advertising Standards Agency.

attributes.action: Increase SMP to be paid for at least 1 year on a % of 90-95
attributes.background:
The miraculous bond between a mother and baby is so essential for the baby’s development in their first years. However current SMP is paid for a short period and not enough in percentage.
Increasing the SMP rate and duration will help mothers to take care of their babies for a longer duration.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the SMP is paid as below in some European Countries:
Denmark:
Length Of Maternity Leave: 52 Weeks
Percentage Of Wages Paid: 100
Serbia:
Length Of Maternity Leave: 52 Weeks
Percentage Of Wages Paid: 100
Sweden: 
Length Of Maternity Leave: 420 Days
Percentage Of Wages Paid: 80
Norway:
Length Of Maternity Leave: 36 to 46 Weeks
Percentage Of Wages Paid: Parental benefits paid at 100 per cent for the shorter duration of leave and 80 per cent for the longer option.

attributes.action: Commission an official memorial in London for the Northern Ireland Veterans.
attributes.background: More than 300,000 members of the British Armed Forces served in Northern Ireland over a period of 38 years, over 1000 lost their lives.  The contribution made to maintaining law and order in the province by members of the Security Forces needs to be recognised in perpetuity.
attributes.additional_details: Martin van Creveld has said that the British Army is unique in Northern Ireland in its success against an irregular force.  The violence was reduced to an extent which made it clear to the PIRA that they would not win through violence. This is a major achievement, and one with which the security forces from all three Services, with the Army in the lead, should be entirely satisfied. It took a long time but, as van Crefeld [sic] said, that success is unique.

attributes.action: Individual Petitions should get Individual Replies, not repeat templates.
attributes.background: Many anti Brexit petitions have been written and supported by at least 10,000 people therefore requiring a Government response. The Government's response has simply been a repeated template churned out with little thought.  This undermines the whole process and the point of petitions.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to space permitting, here's an extract from the repeated template:

On 23 June 2016 the United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union in a referendum provided for by an Act of Parliament.
The Government is committed to implementing the democratic outcome of the referendum.
The Government was clear in the run up to the EU referendum that we would honour the choice made by the people of the UK on 23 June 2016. We will maintain that commitment: the UK will leave the EU.
etc, etc, etc.

attributes.action: Grant children immediate access to life saving drug.
attributes.background:
NHS England have today announced that all early access programmes regarding Nusinersen will be put on hold. They want to open just 5 centres accross the country, this takes time. Time is something many SMA children don't have. 
Please join me in asking NHS England to reverse this decision.
attributes.additional_details:
Nusinersen is the only known treatment of SMA, it is not a miracle cure, however it gives children time and a better quality of life. 
Spinal Muscular Atrophy, what's that you might ask. A month ago I wouldn't have known my self. 
It's an evil disease that effectively makes your child waste away. Their muscles waste until eventually they suffer respiratory failure, the whole time their brain unaffected.

attributes.action: Form a British Expat Committee to defend Expats rights in pre-Brexit negotiation
attributes.background: This Committee is to consist of representatives from Spain, Ireland, Germany, France and Italy to cover the diverse social demographics of the 5 main countries.  It will contend issues raised during the Brexit debate prior to negotiations which adversely affect the rights and welfare of Expats.
attributes.additional_details: Of critical importance is that Government decisions concerning Expats be negotiated with Brussels after having consulted with the committee.  Currently the anxieties and opinions of ordinary Expats are not being sought on issues directly affecting them and their futures.  Government decision-makers will not be affected by outcomes which have an impact on Expats’ rights, healthcare and the benefits they enjoy.  The futures of Expats must not be regarded as bargaining chips.

attributes.action: Introduce meat and dairy taxes to correct market failure in the food industry
attributes.background: Food production causes a quarter of all greenhouse gas emissions that are driving global warming. Both the UN International Research Panel and the Oxford University Martin Programme have suggested pricing in the environmental impacts of meat and dairy are vital steps to combating climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The Oxford report states average surcharges of 40% on beef and 20% on milk would account for the damage they cause people via climate change and Maarten Hajer, the lead author of the UN report has recommended similar action. We hereby call on the government to implement such taxes to help meet our international obligations to combat climate change. 

http://www.nature.com/nclimate/journal/vaop/ncurrent/pdf/nclimate3155.pdf
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/bhhivquadq7ycnd/AAAIl8mVW9GCiOyGwk71At_ra?dl=0

attributes.action: Offer a unilateral guarantee of the rights of EU citizens in the UK post Brexit
attributes.background: More than 900,000 EU citizens are resident in the UK; making a positive contribution to our dynamic, multi-cultural society.  Offering a unilateral guarantee of their rights, without waiting for a reciprocal guarantee will demonstrate to our EU partners our good faith in Brexit negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
No human being deserves to be used a pawn in negotiations between nations.  We have the opportunity to set a positive tone as we engage in Brexit negotiations.  No one seriously believes that a reciprocal offer will not be made; but it's hard for the EU to move fast. 

The UK doesn't have to wait.  These people are our friends, neighbours, colleagues and lovers.  Let's make it clear the kind of nation that we want to be.

attributes.action: Make Freestyle libre sensors and receiver available on the NHS for T1 Diabetics.
attributes.background: I have a Type 1 Diabetic Daughter (nine years old) and T1D since she was 2 years old. Thats 7 years of up to 10 finger pricks a day to test blood glucose. To do this we have test strips and lancets via prescription. This money could fund a freestyle libre instead!
attributes.additional_details:
Freestyle libre reads the blood sugars via a sensor on the back of the arm and then it is scanned by the reader for blood glucose results.
We have only been on this 2 weeks and the change in my Daughters levels is amazing!
Plus she is taking more control of her own Diabetes because she no longer has the discomfort several times a day of pricking her fingers for blood.

I believe that these should be available on the NHS as they cost the same as what it does for lancets and test strips etc ...

attributes.action: Make Asthma Treatment FREE For Asthma Sufferers
attributes.background: I am a life long Asthma Sufferer. I was born with the conditions and throughout my life, I have always wondered why other conditions such as Diabetes and Epilepsy get free medication?
attributes.additional_details:
I am most worried about the 250,000 with severe (uncontrollable) asthma. It's thought they make up more than half of asthma deaths. Costs of their treatments can be considerable - they often need powerful steroid tablets and antibiotics.

Emergency hospital admissions for adults are estimated to cost the NHS £61 million a year and many relate to poor asthma control. 

Better access to medicines keeps people healthy, out of hospital and working. 

Those who manage the budget always look to save money, but charging asthma patients for prescriptions is a back-to-front and morally questionable way to do it.

attributes.action: Any future referendum vote on Scottish Independence must be given to all the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom is exactly that..United.  As part of a legal union Scotland should NOT be able to decide alone on independence as the consequences will affect ALL of the UK economically and politically.
